Operation 'post_/logout' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_context, missing_side_effects. Current description is vague about authentication requirements and side effects. Enhanced version clarifies that TokenHeader authentication is required, explains the side effect (session termination), and indicates that future requests will fail without re-authentication. This helps AI agents understand the operation's full impact.

data.current_description: Log out by deleting your token off the server.
data.description_suggestion: Invalidates the current authentication token by removing it from the server. Requires a valid TokenHeader. After logout, subsequent requests without a new token will be rejected. This operation terminates the authenticated session.
data.reasoning: Current description is vague about authentication requirements and side effects. Enhanced version clarifies that TokenHeader authentication is required, explains the side effect (session termination), and indicates that future requests will fail without re-authentication. This helps AI agents understand the operation's full impact.

message: Operation 'get_/signins' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_context. Summary 'Get signin info' is too generic. Description lacks information about parameters (2 available), authentication requirements, and pagination support. Enhanced version clarifies the operation retrieves attendee signin records, mentions parameter support, specifies authentication, and indicates the response structure for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Returns a list of signin objects sorted by signin ID descending.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of all signin records sorted by signin ID in descending order. Supports filtering and pagination via query parameters. Returns an array of signin objects containing attendee information and timestamps. Requires authentication via TokenHeader.
data.reasoning: Summary 'Get signin info' is too generic. Description lacks information about parameters (2 available), authentication requirements, and pagination support. Enhanced version clarifies the operation retrieves attendee signin records, mentions parameter support, specifies authentication, and indicates the response structure for better AI agent understanding.

data.summary_suggestion: Create a new attendee signin record
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new signin record for an attendee checking in at the premises. Accepts a signin payload containing attendee information and timestamp. Returns a signinResponse object with the created record ID and confirmation. This operation is used to log attendee arrivals for contact tracing purposes.
data.reasoning: Missing summary entirely. Description is minimal and lacks context about what data is expected (signin payload), what is returned (signinResponse), and the domain purpose (contact tracing). data.description_suggestion: Permanently deletes a signin record identified by signinId from the system. This operation removes the attendee check-in record and cannot be undone. Requires authentication via TokenHeader. Returns 204 No Content on successful deletion, or 404 if the signin record does not exist.
data.reasoning: Summary is acceptable but description is minimal and repetitive. Missing authentication requirements, side effects (permanent deletion), response details, and error handling. message: Operation 'post_/verifyPasswordChange' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original summary conflates 'forgot password' with the verification step. Description lacks clarity on required inputs (reset code, new password), expected output, and side effects (token/session invalidation). Improved version clarifies this is the verification step, specifies inputs/outputs, and documents session invalidation behavior for AI agent understanding.

data.current_summary: Used for resetting your password when you forgot it
data.current_description: Another endpoint will generate a password reset code for you. You should use the client app to submit the reset code along with the new password to change your password.
data.summary_suggestion: Verify and apply password reset with code
data.description_suggestion: Completes the password reset process by verifying the password reset code and applying the new password. Requires the reset code (generated by /requestPasswordReset) and the new password as inputs. Returns confirmation of successful password change. Invalidates all existing password reset tokens and active sessions upon successful completion.
data.reasoning: Original summary conflates 'forgot password' with the verification step. Description lacks clarity on required inputs (reset code, new password), expected output, and side effects (token/session invalidation). Improved version clarifies this is the verification step, specifies inputs/outputs, and documents session invalidation behavior for AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: Pass in your old password and your new password
data.description_suggestion: Allows an authenticated user to change their password by providing their current password and desired new password. Requires valid authentication token. Returns confirmation of successful password change. Invalidates all active sessions for the user upon successful completion, requiring re-authentication.
data.reasoning: Original summary and description are too minimal. Missing context about authentication requirement, what happens to sessions, and what is returned. message: Operation 'post_/requestPasswordReset' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original description contains implementation rationale that obscures the operation's purpose. Missing clear input/output specification. Improved version focuses on what the operation does, who uses it, what inputs/outputs are involved, and the key operational detail about manual code delivery, making it clearer for AI agents to determine when to use this endpoint.

data.current_summary: Used for requesting a password reset code
data.current_description: The admin should run this on behalf of a user who forgot their password. The API will generate a password reset code which the admin should then provide to the user. The user can use their client to reset their password. Normally the password reset code is mailed to the user, but I didn't want to do this in this case because I didn't want to introduce the complicated dependency of having an SMTP server just for this purpose. Doing it this way makes it easy for people to adopt this API.
data.summary_suggestion: Generate password reset code for user
data.description_suggestion: Generates a password reset code for a user who has forgotten their password. Intended for admin use on behalf of the user. Requires the user ID as input. Returns a password reset code that the admin must provide to the user out-of-band. The user can then use this code with /verifyPasswordChange to reset their password. Note: Password reset codes are not automatically mailed; the admin is responsible for communicating the code to the user.
data.reasoning: Original description contains implementation rationale that obscures the operation's purpose. Missing clear input/output specification. Improved version focuses on what the operation does, who uses it, what inputs/outputs are involved, and the key operational detail about manual code delivery, making it clearer for AI agents to determine when to use this endpoint.
